description: First up, the European Central Bank has a key decision on the way that could shape financial markets today. And 14.3 percent of American households were "food insecure" at some point last year — not enough food for an active, healthy life. That's a slight improvement from 2012, but notably higher than prerecession levels. One big reason: Food prices are rising faster than inflation. Plus, the U.S. Supreme Court holds that corporations have free-speech rights. That means companies are free to give money to political campaigns. But what do people who work in one of the richest of industries think about that?
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday September 4, 2014
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday September 4, 2014
byline: Nova Safo, Mitchell Hartman, David Brancaccio and David Gura
